intro: Stellara, commonly known as starflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which typically feature five petals arranged symmetrically. The leaves are usually small, often succulent, and adapted to arid environments. Stellara species are native to regions in Europe, Asia, and Africa, and many are found in rocky or sandy soils. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are also used in traditional medicine.
